reviews.text: WE just returned home from staying at this hotel Sept 22 thru Sept 25 2011. We found the check in fast, efficient. Hotel room was very clean, and housekeeping staff did an excellent job. We thought that the tub was not draining, but apparently we had the plug semi in the drain, but the housekeeping staff made sure that it was the way it was supposed to be, so the next shower it drained all the time. No sign of any bed bugs, the room was quiet. The hot tub was out of order, but we didn't actually know there was one. We did not have time to try out the pool but looked inviting.
reviews.title: Go to the Comfort Inn! or anywhere else

reviews.text: Recently, I was in Ottawa on business and was disappointed that I could not check into the Chimo Hotel upon my arrival at 8:30 am. Once I did finally check into my room, a Silver guest room, I found it to be average. The bathroom could definitely have been cleaner and I was surprised that there was no room service menu in the room. Internet was complementary but there was no access code. I think this is a minimum level of internet security that should be provided by the hotel. However, the worst thing about this hotel, as far as I am concerned, is the gym. It is tiny. Im my opinion, it is only comfortable for there to be two people in it at a time. Needless to say, there is not much variety in equipment and there is only one piece of each equipment. By the way, for those who are interested, the hot tub is still not functional.

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in May 2006 with family. (We required 2 rooms). The first room we were given was not acceptable for a 3 Star Hotel in North America (which tend to be better than 3 star hotels in Europe). The carpet was filthy, there was a clearly visible layer of dust on all cupboards, drawers, TV. There were even toe nail clippings at the side of the bed. The bath and shower showed the worse for wear - very old worn out bath, leaking showere head and black mildew/bacteria on the tiles. Towels were, although clean, were worn out. So I complained, the receptionist said sorry and gave me keys to view another room - which was in an identical state of filth! The hotel was really buzy - there were 2 functions on and lots of people running around the corridors into the early hours of the morning. When I phoned the receptionist again, she was appologetic but said that ultimately there was not a lot she could do to stop them running around until 2.00am. There is also a club nearby, that has live bands at the weekend, so it is very difficult to get to sleep (should you stay at the weekend) as the building is not soundproof. The only thing nearby is a shopping mall. There is no decent restaurants nearby, and a fair jaunt into the town by foot - so you would really need a car. I certainly would not recommend this hotel to anyone, it is remote, nothing nearby and is dirty.
reviews.title: A Hellish Hotel!

reviews.text: Our room wasn't the cleanest, the toilet ran, the tap in the sink was disgusting, the bathtub wouldn't empty when you had a shower and it took 3 days for us to get them to give us sufficient towels. Even though they knew there were 3 people in the room they would only give 2 sets of towels. Asking for another set got us anywhere from 2 to 6 bath towels only. No hand towels or facecloths. The one phone in the room that worked to call out, wouldn't accept calls coming in. We reported this twice and were told that they couldn't see anything wrong with the phone. Luckily we had our cell phones and that was how we stayed in contact with friends.
